Sure, here are some examples of provocative questions from the Spark Selling methodology that start with "how" instead of "what":

1. "How are you currently addressing this challenge?"
2. "How do you see this impacting your business in the long run?"
3. "How do you envision this product/service fitting into your operations?"
4. "How does it feel when your team is struggling to close deals?"
5. "How does it feel when your business is losing market share?"
6. "How does it feel when a potential customer chooses your competitor over you?"
7. "How does it make you feel when your team misses their sales targets?"
8. "How does it impact your business when your competitors are more successful than you?"
9. "How do you see this issue impacting your company's overall goals and objectives?"
10. "How does it feel when your customer gives you negative feedback?"

These questions are designed to help the salesperson understand the customer's true needs, pain points and objectives and to provide solutions that align with those needs. They are also meant to help the customer see the potential consequences of not addressing the problem or opportunity and to consider the potential benefits of taking action.
